snippet: The United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit ruled that the voter-approved ban on affirmative action was unconstitutional.
abstract: United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit rules, 8 to 7, that Michigan's voter-approved 2006 ban on affirmative action was unconstitutional.
lead_paragraph: The United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit ruled that the voter-approved ban on affirmative action was unconstitutional.

headline.seo: Michigan’s Affirmative Action Ban Is Ruled Unconstitutional
headline.main: Affirmative Action Ban in Michigan Is Rejected
headline.print_headline: Affirmative Action Ban In Michigan Is Rejected
